subject: RE: [junit] Re: How to test private methods in a class.
msgSnippet: But this (testing private methods) helps in quickly localizing the source of the problem. Doesn’t it? ... From: junit@yahoogroups.com
messageBody:
But this (testing private methods) helps in quickly localizing the source of the problem. Doesn’t it?



-----Original Message-----
From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Elliotte Harold
Sent: Monday, September 05, 2005 2:43 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Re: How to test private methods in a class.



Iliya Agoshkov wrote:

> Or I don't need to test em at all (cause they are tested through the
> test of 'public search(...)' method)??

Half right. You do need to test these methods. You test them by invoking
the public search method. Test methods do not need to directly invoke a
method in order to test it, provided that the methods they do invoke
ultimately reach into the methods being tested.

--
﻿Elliotte Rusty Harold elharo@...
